div.p:
After I had sent off
the corrections of your
friend I regretted
that I had not
incorporated them
into 4th Revise myself
and sent him new
matter. If you will
kindly return them
namely B. C. D I shall
do so and today
I send pages 43-89
2nd Revise - which
are a portion of the
journey up the river
to the Falls, and if
he will let me have
them back in the
course of the week
I shall then be
able to give him
the narrative con-
secutively, and I
have no doubt
he may be able to
point out omissions.
I am glad he mentions
the want of inform
ation about the
"steamers". What I added
will give offence to
no one.

As by sending back
your friend's corrections
to me & 4th Revise
I relieve him from
the work of in
corporating his
corrections. I suppose
he may have gone
over 43-89 now
sent by Wednesday
next and will
therefore send new
matters on that day
to keep him going - the
reason why the con-
secutive narrative is
not sent is I made
additions & these have
not come back from
Clowes. He will do
good service by
going over it as a
whole - there may
be repetitions which
I don't notice - I
think sometimes I walk
into the Portuguese
too savagely. Hoping
you will excuse
this trouble.
